alert.note: Alert for Bee; Live Oak (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 22 at 11:16AM CDT until August 22 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a * Tornado Warning for... East central Live Oak County in south central Texas... Central Bee County in south central Texas... * Until 1145 AM CDT. * At 1115 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Beeville, moving west at 45 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Live Oak and central Bee Counties. This includes the following highways... US Highway 181 between mile markers 588 and 598. US Highway 59 between mile markers 690 and 712. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
